intro: Coccoloba diversifolia, commonly known as the variegated beautyberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in coastal areas and disturbed soils. The plant features palmately lobed leaves that are often variegated with white or cream markings. Its small, clustered flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in the spring. The fruit is a small, bright red berry that ripens in the fall and is an important food source for various bird species.
